Find the closest stores (uses your location) 1 (.25 ounce) package active dry yeast ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup warm water ADVERTISEMENT 2 cups whole wheat flour ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup wheat germ ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon honey ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 10 m Cook 10 m Ready In 20 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a small bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water. Let stand until creamy, about 10 minutes. In a large bowl combine flour, wheat germ and salt. Make a well in the middle and add honey and yeast mixture. Find the closest stores (uses your location) 2 cups red lentils ADVERTISEMENT 1 large onion, diced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon vegetable oil ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons curry paste ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon curry powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground turmeric ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon ground cumin ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon white sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced garlic ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.25 ounce) can tomato puree ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 10 m Cook 30 m Ready In 40 m Wash the lentils in cold water until the water runs clear. Put lentils in a pot with enough water to cover; bring to a boil, place a cover on the pot, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer, adding water during cooking as needed to keep covered, until tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Drain. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir onions in hot oil until caramelized, about 20 minutes. Mix curry paste, curry powder, turmeric, cumin, chili powder, salt, sugar, garlic, and ginger together in a large bowl; stir into the onions. Increase heat to high and cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato puree, remove from heat and stir into the lentils.

Find the closest stores (uses your location) 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 (12 ounce) package frozen corn kernels, thawed ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups finely diced celery ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup diced red onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shallot, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon tomato paste ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme leaves ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 bay leaf ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 potato, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 30 m Cook 1 h Ready In 1 h 30 m Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the sweet potatoes into a 9x13 inch baking dish, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of corn oil, and season with salt and pepper. Stir to coat the sweet potatoes in oil. Roast in the preheated oven until the sweet potatoes are golden and tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally as they cook so the sweet potatoes cook evenly. Meanwhile, measure out 1 cup of corn kernels and set aside. Place the remaining corn into a blender, and puree with the water until smooth; set aside. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of corn oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the celery, onion, and shallot. Cook and stir until the onion has softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and dried thyme leaves; cook 1 minute more. Pour in the vegetable broth, corn puree, bay leaf, salt, and cubed potato. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the potato is tender, 25 to 35 minutes. Once the potato is tender, remove and discard the bay leaf. Stir in the whole corn kernels, sweet potato, and chopped parsley. Return to a simmer and season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.

Mix in the oat bran, quick oats, and rice; the mixture should seem a little dry. In a separate bowl, mash the tofu with your hands, trying to squeeze out as much of the water as possible. Add diced tomatoes, tomato paste, water, and soup mix. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover, and simmer for 45 minutes. Find the closest stores (uses your location) 1 butternut squash, halved and seeded ADVERTISEMENT 2 large onions, peeled and quartered ADVERTISEMENT 1 medium head garlic ADVERTISEMENT 6 cups vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 bay leaf ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon mild curry powder ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried oregano ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup plain yogurt ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup chopped fresh parsley (optional) ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 30 m Cook 1 h 10 m Ready In 1 h 40 m Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil. Place squash halves and onion onto the prepared baking sheet. Wrap garlic in foil and set with other vegetables. Roast in the center of the oven for 45 to 60 minutes, until the squash is tender. Remove from oven and set aside until cool enough to handle. Squeeze garlic cloves out of their skin like paste into a food processor. Scrape the flesh from the squash and place into the food processor along with the roasted onion. Puree until smooth. Add vegetable broth if necessary. Transfer the pureed mixture to a stockpot and stir in vegetable broth. Season with the bay leaf, brown sugar, curry powder, oregano, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil and simmer gently for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in yogurt. Remove bay leaf and serve hot. Garnish with fresh parsley if desired.

Pierce potatoes with a fork and bake until soft, about 1 hour. Remove from oven and cool until potatoes can be handled, about 20 minutes. Reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Place vegetables in a roasting pan and place them in the 450 degrees F (230 degrees C) oven. Stir the vegetable every 15 minutes. Although the vegetables are no longer necessary for your broth they are delicious to eat hot or cold, don't waste them!

Find the closest stores (uses your location) 2 sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT salt and pepper to taste ADVERTISEMENT 1 (12 ounce) package frozen corn kernels, thawed ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup water ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon corn oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 1/2 cups finely diced celery ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup diced red onion ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup shallot, minced ADVERTISEMENT 1 tablespoon tomato paste ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon dried thyme leaves ADVERTISEMENT 3 cups vegetable broth ADVERTISEMENT 1 bay leaf ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1 potato, peeled and cubed ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 30 m Cook 1 h Ready In 1 h 30 m Preheat an oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Place the sweet potatoes into a 9x13 inch baking dish, drizzle with 1 tablespoon of corn oil, and season with salt and pepper. Stir to coat the sweet potatoes in oil. Roast in the preheated oven until the sweet potatoes are golden and tender, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir occasionally as they cook so the sweet potatoes cook evenly. Meanwhile, measure out 1 cup of corn kernels and set aside. Place the remaining corn into a blender, and puree with the water until smooth; set aside. Heat the remaining 1 tablespoon of corn oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the celery, onion, and shallot. Cook and stir until the onion has softened, about 5 minutes. Stir in the tomato paste and dried thyme leaves; cook 1 minute more. Pour in the vegetable broth, corn puree, bay leaf, salt, and cubed potato. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce the heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until the potato is tender, 25 to 35 minutes. Once the potato is tender, remove and discard the bay leaf. Stir in the whole corn kernels, sweet potato, and chopped parsley. Return to a simmer and season to taste with salt and pepper before serving.

Find the closest stores (uses your location) 1 cup dried navy beans ADVERTISEMENT 4 cups water ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup ketchup ADVERTISEMENT 1/4 cup maple syrup ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons brown sugar ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons molasses ADVERTISEMENT 1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce ADVERTISEMENT 1/2 teaspoon salt ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon ground black pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1/8 teaspoon chili powder ADVERTISEMENT 1 small onion, chopped ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 10 m Cook 8 h Ready In 15 h 30 m Place the navy beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let stand 8 hours to overnight. Or, bring the beans and water to a boil in a large pot over high heat. Once boiling, turn off the heat, cover, and let stand 1 hour. Drain and rinse before using. Place the beans in a large saucepan with 4 cups of water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 1 hour. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Stir the ketchup, maple syrup, brown sugar, molasses, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and chili powder together in a small bowl; set aside. Once the beans have simmered for 1 hour, drain, and reserve the cooking liquid. Pour the beans into a 1 1/2 quart casserole dish and stir in the chopped onion and the molasses sauce. Stir in enough of the reserved cooking liquid so the sauce covers the beans by 1/4 inch. Cover, and bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes, then reduce the heat to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C), and cook 6 hours longer. Stir the beans after they have cooked for 3 hours. Once the beans are tender and the sauce has reduced and is sticky, remove from the oven, stir, recover, and allow to stand 15 minutes before serving.

answer_units.title: Grilled Vegetables in Balsamic Tomato Sauce with Couscous

content.text: Â made itÂ  |Â  46 reviews Recipe by: Christopher O'Hearn "The sweetness of grilled vegetables is balanced by a tart tomato sauce, which mixes perfectly with simple couscous. Preferably use a heavy grill pan. If you don't have one you can use a baking tray beneath an oven grill, or even roast the vegetables in a hot oven and then transfer them to a pan for the last part. But you will get more of the char-grill flavor if you use a pan. If you want to make more or less couscous, just use the same quantity of water as couscous. This dish keeps well, as the flavor of the vegetables seems to grow stronger. It is just as nice served lightly warmed for lunch as hot for a dinner, or use it as a cold dish in a selection of salads." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

Find the closest stores (uses your location) 1 tablespoon olive oil ADVERTISEMENT 1 red bell pepper ADVERTISEMENT 1 zucchini ADVERTISEMENT 1 small eggplant ADVERTISEMENT 1 large sweet onion ADVERTISEMENT 3/4 cup frozen broad beans ADVERTISEMENT 1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes ADVERTISEMENT 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup couscous ADVERTISEMENT 1 cup vegetable stock ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list ADVERTISEMENT Add all ingredients to list May we suggest ADVERTISEMENT Prep 20 m Cook 15 m Ready In 35 m Remove the seeds from the pepper, and chop into strips about 1 to 2 inches long. Cut the eggplant crossways into rounds about 1/3 to 1/2 inch thick, and cut each one into 6 to 8 even chunks. Peel the onion, and chop into 8 portions. Trim the zucchini, and cut into thick slices. Heat grill pan over a high heat with a generous splash of olive oil. When it is very hot, add all the vegetables to the pan. Press down occasionally to get grill lines across them. Turn occasionally to prevent burning. Cook for about 15 minutes, or until the vegetables are evenly browned and cooked through. Stir broad beans into the vegetables. Add chopped tomatoes, and vinegar. Simmer for a few minutes while the couscous is prepared. Place couscous into a medium bowl. Add boiling vegetable stock, and stir with a fork. Keep lifting the couscous occasionally to prevent it sticking. It only takes 2 to 3 minutes to become soft. Place couscous in a large bowl or serving platter, and serve the vegetables on top.

content.text: Â made itÂ  |Â  27 reviews Recipe by: Snacks "I acquired both my nickname and the idea for this recipe while working at an awful franchised restaurant in my college years. For people such as myself who have acid reflux I have indicated some ingredients that can be left out in order to help curb the heartburn." Added to shopping list. Go to shopping list.

Toss the mushrooms, onion, bell pepper, tomatoes, and chicken in the marinade; cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate. On each skewer, thread a piece of chicken, then three of the veggies followed by another piece of chicken then a pineapple slice and one maraschino cherry at the end. Mix and match the vegetables as you assemble the skewers. Cook on the preheated grill until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and the vegetables are tender, about 10 minutes.
